subject: Newsquawk Central Banks Weekly Briefing - 1st May 2020: Previewing BOE, RBA, Norges Bank; Reviewing FOMC, ECB, BOJ, Riksbank

UK is to start trade talks with the US next week, according to The Sun
US VP Pence says the 1mln vials of remdesivir will start being distributed to hospitals on Monday
President Trump says FDA has approved Gilead's (GILD) remdesivir for emergency use authorization; says the Co is donating 1mln vials of the drug

White House Press Press Secretary says US wants to negotiate the next stimulus bill immediately

AT&T's (T) Warner Media reached a distribution agreement with HBO Max where it will be available to Hulu subscribers when the platform launches on May 27th
Clorox (CLX) says COVID-19 related costs to its supply chain will be more pronounced in Q4 and it has temporarily suspended its share repurchase programme

United Airline (UAL) is planning to cut its workforce if there is not a swift rebound in air travel, according to the FT

Phillips 66 (PSX) says we are far from filling up on US refined products storage
Interactive Brokers (IBKR) reports 1.729mln DARTs in April (+121% Y/Y); April client equity at USD 179.8bln (+19% Y/Y)

NYSE is to hold a meeting with the floor community on Tuesday; officials likely to address a timetable for reopening, but unlikely to set firm date, although could provide guidance, according to FBN's Gasparino

Facebook (FB) is reportedly at risk of losing a key seal of approval for advertisement measurement which provides companies with confidence they are getting what they pay for when advertising with FB, according to WSJ
ANALYSIS: April's ISM manufacturing was better than expected, though it is still bad, and the employment sub-index does not bode well for next week's jobs report

Tesla (TSLA) CEO Musk says the stock price is too high in his opinion
LyondellBasell (LYB) to operate most plants between 60-80% of capacity in Q2

Exxon (XOM) CEO says is expects transportation fuel sales in Asia, US and Europe to improve although does not expect a bump in Jet fuel yet
